swerve

Class SwerveWheel

  • java.lang.Object
    • SubsystemBase
      • swerve.SwerveWheel

  • public abstract class SwerveWheel
extends SubsystemBase
    An abstract class used by SwerveDrive to represent a module. Each SwerveWheel contains a wheel which can rotate in any direction and drive forwards or backwards. Note: Based on encoder functionality, the wheel should be facing directly forwards when this subsystem is instantiated, or resetEncoder() should be used along with a homing sequence.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SwerveWheel

        public SwerveWheel()

    • Method Detail

      • getRotation

        protected abstract double getRotation()
        Returns:
        The wheel's positional rotation in revolutions, starting with 0 = directly forwards and increasing as the wheel rotates clockwise (from a top-down point of view). The output should not be trimmed to stay within a certain range (i.e. an output of 1.2 rotations should not be looped around to the equivalent angle 0.2 rotations).

      • setRotation

        protected abstract void setRotation(double targetRotation)
        This should set the target positional rotation of the wheel, using the same rotational measurement as getRotation(). This means that if you were to pass 1.2 as an argument, the input should not wrap to the equivalent angle of 0.2, and the module should instead perform whatever rotational action is necessary in order to make the output of getRotation() closer to 1.2.
        Parameters:
        targetRotation - The target rotation
        See Also:
        setSpeedAndRotation(double, double), setSpeed(double)

      • setSpeed

        protected abstract void setSpeed(double speed)
        Sets the directional speed of the wheel on the interval [-1, 1].
        Parameters:
        speed - The direction speed
        See Also:
        setSpeedAndRotation(double, double), setRotation(double)

      • stopRotationalMovement

        protected abstract void stopRotationalMovement()
        Immediately stops all rotational movement.

      • resetEncoder

        public abstract void resetEncoder()
        Resets the encoders to a position of zero. This should only be used when it is certain that the wheel is facing directly forward (i.e. the encoders are properly set up such that getRotation() will return the correct rotation when called).

      • setSpeedAndRotation

        public final void setSpeedAndRotation(double targetRot,
                                      double speed)
        Sets the directional speed of the wheel, along with the target rotation position of the module. The speed of the wheel should be on the interval [-1, 1], and the target rotation should be on the interval [0, 360). A target rotation of 0 degrees should correspond with moving directly forward, where an increase in target rotation corresponds with a clockwise movement in target rotational position (from a top-down point of view).
        Parameters:
        targetRot - The target rotational position, as specified above
        speed - The directional speed of the wheel
        See Also:
        setSpeed(double), setRotation(double)

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops all movement within the module.
